item.title: What is Mastodon?
item.description: Mastodon is an open-source microblogging platform created by Eugen Rochko in 2016 - It has features that are similar to Twitter which are provided to users through independently managed “nodes” or “instances”. Every account/user on Mastodon will belong to an individual instance rather than one “central” authority unlike Twitter. Instances can be run by any individual, group or organization & will feature their own terms of service, code of conduct & moderation teams.

item.title: How is Mastodon different from Twitter?
item.description: Mastodon & Twitter accomplish short-form microblogging in very different ways - The end result might “look” similar but there are some important differences that we should dive into For Profit vs Community Funded Twitter is a for-profit entity for what has historically been an entirely free-to-use, advertisement supported platform. This has meant that the product of the platform is the end-users themselves (through serving advertisements & selling data) - Mastodon on the other hand has no advertisements & you have more control over your data.
